The event flyer for: The Originalist Case for Inciting Insurrection" was found, which listed the date, time, and speakers (Sen. Josh Hawley and Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton) for the event.
The flyer mentioned that: riot information" would be emailed to attendees on the morning of January 6, suggesting a connection to the Capitol siege.
The Stanford Federalist Society: a libertarian and conservative student group at Stanford Law School, was identified as the alleged host of the event.
Stephanie Ashe: the director of media relations for Stanford Law School, confirmed that the event flyer was not real and that it was emailed to a student-run listserv on January 25, not on January 6 as claimed.
